cellot.networks package#

Submodules#

cellot.networks.icnns module#

Implementation of input convex neural networks.

class cellot.networks.icnns.ICNN(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)#

Bases: torch.nn.Module

Implementation of a input convex nueral network.

Variables

  • input_dim (int) – the dimension of the input.

  • hidden_units (list) – the number of units on each hidden layer.

  • activation (str) – the employed activation function. Default is ‘LeakyReLU’.

  • softplus_W_kernels (bool) – whether to use softplus to ensure nonnegative weights. Default is False.

  • softplus_beta (float) – the scale for the softplus kernel. Default is 1.

  • fnorm_penalty (float) – the penalty strength for negative weights. Default is 0.

  • kernel_init_fxn – a function used to intialize weights. Default is None.

clamp_w()#

Forcibly sets negative weights to zero to ensure nonnegativity.

forward(x)#

Computes the output of the ICNN given some input x.

penalize_w()#

Computes the penalty for negative weights.

transport(x: torch.tensor)#

Computes the predicted perturbed features of a cell given its original features.

According to theory, the prediction is the gradient of the scalar output w.r.t to the network input, evaluated at the specific samples x here.

class cellot.networks.icnns.NonNegativeLinear(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)#

Bases: torch.nn.Linear

Implementation of a single neural network layer with nonnegative weights.

Variables

beta (float) – the scale for the softplus kernel. Default is 1.

forward(x)#

Computes the output of this layer given the input.

kernel()#

Builds the softplus kernel of weights using the attribute beta.

cellot.networks.icnns.test_icnn_convexity(icnn: cellot.networks.icnns.ICNN)#

Tests if an instance of ICNN is indeed input convex.

Parameters

icnn – an instance of the class ICNN.

Raises

AssertionError – if icnn is not input convex.
